snippet: The American military for the first time will require generals and admirals to be evaluated by the people they command on qualities including character.
abstract: American military will for first time require generals and admirals to be evaluated by peers and subordinates on qualities including character; effort, led by Joint Chiefs chairman Gen Martin E Dempsey, is part of broad overhaul of training and development protocols for generals and admirals, initiated after series of scandals involving high-ranking officers.
lead_paragraph: The American military for the first time will require generals and admirals to be evaluated by the people they command on qualities including character.

headline.seo: Military’s Top Officers Face Review of Their Character
headline.main: Conduct at Issue as Military Officers Face a New Review
headline.print_headline: Conduct at Issue As Subordinates Review Officers

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
